subject: Business
title: Charm Pricing: The Power of 99
description: A 60-second lesson on Charm Pricing: The Power of 99.

hook.text: $9.99 feels dramatically cheaper than $10.00. The difference is one cent. The perception gap is enormous.

buildup.text: Charm pricing uses prices ending in 9 or 99 because our brains process the leftmost digit first.

discovery.text: Studies show items priced at $39 outsell identical items at $34. The 9-ending signals 'deal.'

twist.text: Luxury brands avoid charm pricing. Whole numbers ($100, $500) signal quality, not deals.

climax.text: The right pricing strategy depends on your brand position: bargain brands use .99, premium brands use .00.

punchline.text: One cent changes everything. But only in the right direction.

quiz.question: Why do prices ending in .99 feel cheaper?
options: Our brains process the leftmost digit first
Stores are legally required to round down
